items.author: Hal Hinson
items.content: For once, the audience isn't forced to surrender its intelligence (or its healthy cynicism) to embrace the film's sunny resolution.

items.author: Scott Tobias
items.content: A hilarious and unexpectedly profound comedy.

items.author: James Berardinelli
items.content: This movie has all the qualities necessary to be a crowd-pleaser: likable characters, charismatic performers, a strong, capably-executed premise, and lots of laughs.

items.author: Stanley Kauffmann
items.content: Murray, more often than not, is pretty unbearable; but here, playing a man who is unbearable, Murray begins convincingly, amusingly, and gets even more amusing as he metamorphoses. [15 Mar 1993, p.24]

items.author: Elvis Mitchell
items.content: That glimmer of recognition is what makes Groundhog Day a particularly witty and resonant comedy, even when its jokes are more apt to prompt gentle giggles than rolling in the aisles.

items.author: Roger Ebert
items.content: A demonstration of the way time can sometimes give us a break.

items.author: Austin Chronicle
items.content: There were a lot of ways for this film to go stupid; it succumbs to none of them.

items.author: Owen Gleiberman
items.content: The funniest moments in Groundhog Day come when Phil takes sneaky advantage of his predicament-by, say, pumping a sexy woman in the local coffee shop for facts about her past and then, ''the next day,'' using the information to lure her into bed. What the movie lacks is the ingenious, lapidary comic structure that could have made these moments fuse into something tricky and wild.

items.author: Rick Groen
items.content: Dial your expectations to moderate, burrow in for the duration, and you won't be disappointed - it ain't exactly springtime, but there are worse things than an amiable outing on a winter's night.

items.author: Jonathan Rosenbaum
items.content: Considering that none of the characters is fresh or interesting, it's a commendable achievement that the quality of the storytelling alone keeps the movie watchable and likable.
